other_tests.procedure_name: MRI of the brain with gadolinium
other_tests.findings: An 18 /H1100320/H1100321-mm enhancing mass that displaced the right optic nerve and demonstrated flow void on T2 imaging consistent with a hemangioblastoma.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient's ophthalmic examination and MRI remained unchanged upon follow-up in 1997. In 1998, her visual field defects slightly worsened.

other_tests.findings: A homogenously enhancing lesion in the suprasellar region, abutting the left aspect of the optic chiasm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI 6 months later showed an increase in size of the mass with mild compression of the left temporal region of the optic chiasm.

other_tests.findings: A 7 /H1100310-mm mass of the intracanalicular portion of the left optic nerve associated with some mild edema of the optic chiasm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: In January 2007, MRI revealed that the optic nerve tumor was essentially unchanged in size, but the chiasmal edema had increased and was tracking further along the optic tracts.

other_tests.findings: Complete excision of the tumor with resolution of the chiasmal and optic tract edema.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the last follow-up 6 months postoperatively, the left eye had improved to 20/320 and the right eye remained stable at 20/20.

other_tests.findings: Contrast signal change in the region of previous resection.
